Comment 3: 
I can reproduce, although it is sporadic.

It looks like there are occasional spells of heap growth (50mb up to ~500mb live data)
and then it recovers back to 50.

Turning off concurrent sweep seems to fix the problem, so it is some interaction between
that and the settype change.  I can't yet tell if it is a real leak (dead objects being
kept alive somehow) or some instability in when the runtime decides to trigger a gc.

Let me look more tonight.  If I can't figure something out, we'll revert tomorrow. 
Unless this is blocking someone, then you can revert earlier.
